goal.en: The goal of this course is to provide basic knowledge of medical physics, comprising radiotherapy physics, radiobiology, diagnostic imaging physics, nuclear medicine physics, radiation dosimetry, and medical health physics for Biomedical Engineering students.
goal.ch: 醫用物理學結合物理學、基礎醫學、分子結構、影像醫學等原理將物理學的理論應用於醫療診斷與治療，為生醫工程領域學生應具備的專業領域之一。課程將從基礎醫學物理理論與發展，再探討醫學物理於臨床診斷與治療應用原理，包含影像醫學、分子作用原理、放射治療、核子醫學、保健物理、輻射劑量測等基礎，培養學生具備臨床醫學物理的專業能力。

content.en:
1. Introduction of medical physics: why physics in medicine
2. Radiation dosimetry
3. Interaction of gamma rays and x-rays with matter
4. Interactions of charged particles with matter
5. Radiation biology (1)
6. Radiation biology (2)
7. Particle accelerators in medicine
8. Treatment planning in radiation therapy
9. Midterm
10. Image-guided radiation therapy
11. Introduction to radiological images
12. Mammography
13. Computed tomography
14. Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI)
15. Ultrasound
16. Nuclear medicine physics
17. Radiation Shielding and Protection
18. Final exam

en.competency: Learn the basics of mathematics, physics, chemistry, medicine, biology and their applications in healthcare
Ability to perform experimental design, data analysis and inference
Familiar with clinical medicine, and cultivate the ability of design, development, and field applications of biomedical devices or materials
Familiar with the principles of sensing elements, learn the ability to design, manufacture and integrate intelligent systems
The ability to discover, explore, analyze, process and reconstruct problems
Cultivate the ability of integrating multi-level cross-domain teamwork
Understand the reconciliation between professional knowledge and humanistic ethics, as well as the impact of technology on the environment and society, and the ability to continuous learning
